intro: Hieracium lonchophorum, commonly known as the long-haired hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of both yellow disk flowers and white to pale yellow ray florets. Hieracium lonchophorum is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
